00140 /**************************************************************************/
00156 int _read(int file, char *ptr, int len)
00157 {
00158   int c, rxCount = 0;
00159 
00160   (void) file;
00161 
00162   while (len--)
00163   {
00164     if ((c = RETARGET_ReadChar()) != -1)
00165     {
00166       *ptr++ = c;
00167       rxCount++;
00168     }
00169     else
00170     {
00171       break;
00172     }
00173   }
00174 
00175   if (rxCount <= 0)
00176   {
00177     return -1;                        /* Error exit */
00178   }
00179 
00180   return rxCount;
00181 }
00182 
00183 /**************************************************************************/
00193 caddr_t _sbrk(int incr)
00194 {
00195   static char       *heap_end;
00196   char              *prev_heap_end;
00197   static const char heaperr[] = "Heap and stack collision\n";
00198 
00199   if (heap_end == 0)
00200   {
00201     heap_end = &_end;
00202   }
00203 
00204   prev_heap_end = heap_end;
00205   if ((heap_end + incr) > (char*) __get_MSP())
00206   {
00207     _write(fileno(stdout), heaperr, strlen(heaperr));
00208     exit(1);
00209   }
00210   heap_end += incr;
00211 
00212   return (caddr_t) prev_heap_end;
00213 }

00215 /**************************************************************************/
00231 int _write(int file, const char *ptr, int len)
00232 {
00233   int txCount;
00234 
00235   (void) file;
00236 
00237   for (txCount = 0; txCount < len; txCount++)
00238   {
00239     RETARGET_WriteChar(*ptr++);
00240   }
00241 
00242   return len;
00243 }

00246 #if defined(__ICCARM__)
00247 /*******************
00248  *
00249  * Copyright 1998-2003 IAR Systems.  All rights reserved.
00250  *
00251  * $Revision: 38614 $
00252  *
00253  * This is a template implementation of the "__write" function used by
00254  * the standard library.  Replace it with a system-specific
00255  * implementation.
00256  *
00257  * The "__write" function should output "size" number of bytes from
00258  * "buffer" in some application-specific way.  It should return the
00259  * number of characters written, or _LLIO_ERROR on failure.
00260  *
00261  * If "buffer" is zero then __write should perform flushing of
00262  * internal buffers, if any.  In this case "handle" can be -1 to
00263  * indicate that all handles should be flushed.
00264  *
00265  * The template implementation below assumes that the application
00266  * provides the function "MyLowLevelPutchar".  It should return the
00267  * character written, or -1 on failure.
00268  *
00269  ********************/
00270 
00271 #include <yfuns.h>
00272 #include <stdint.h>
00273 
00274 _STD_BEGIN
00275 
00276 /**************************************************************************/
00282 static int TxBuf(uint8_t *buffer, int nbytes)
00283 {
00284   int i;
00285 
00286   for (i = 0; i < nbytes; i++)
00287   {
00288     RETARGET_WriteChar(*buffer++);
00289   }
00290   return nbytes;
00291 }
00292 
00293 /*
00294  * If the __write implementation uses internal buffering, uncomment
00295  * the following line to ensure that we are called with "buffer" as 0
00296  * (i.e. flush) when the application terminates.
00297  */
00298 
00299 size_t __write(int handle, const unsigned char * buffer, size_t size)
00300 {
00301   /* Remove the #if #endif pair to enable the implementation */
00302 
00303   size_t nChars = 0;
00304 
00305   if (buffer == 0)
00306   {
00307     /*
00308      * This means that we should flush internal buffers.  Since we
00309      * don't we just return.  (Remember, "handle" == -1 means that all
00310      * handles should be flushed.)
00311      */
00312     return 0;
00313   }
00314 
00315   /* This template only writes to "standard out" and "standard err",
00316    * for all other file handles it returns failure. */
00317   if (handle != _LLIO_STDOUT && handle != _LLIO_STDERR)
00318   {
00319     return _LLIO_ERROR;
00320   }
00321 
00322   /* Hook into USART1 transmit function here */
00323   if (TxBuf((uint8_t *) buffer, size) != size)
00324     return _LLIO_ERROR;
00325   else
00326     nChars = size;
00327 
00328   return nChars;
00329 }
00330 
00331 size_t __read(int handle, unsigned char * buffer, size_t size)
00332 {
00333   /* Remove the #if #endif pair to enable the implementation */
00334   int nChars = 0;
00335 
00336   /* This template only reads from "standard in", for all other file
00337    * handles it returns failure. */
00338   if (handle != _LLIO_STDIN)
00339   {
00340     return _LLIO_ERROR;
00341   }
00342 
00343   for (/* Empty */; size > 0; --size)
00344   {
00345     int c = RETARGET_ReadChar();
00346     if (c < 0)
00347       break;
00348 
00349     *buffer++ = c;
00350     ++nChars;
00351   }
00352 
00353   return nChars;
00354 }

00358 #endif /* defined( __ICCARM__ ) */
